SEARCH
Package photoalbum.gui.controller

Class AdminController

java.lang.Object
photoalbum.gui.controller.AdminController
All Implemented Interfaces:
LogoutController
public class AdminController extends Object implements LogoutController
This class serves as the controller for the Admin view in a JavaFX application. It manages the user interface interactions related to administrative tasks such as adding or deleting users, refreshing the user list, and logging off.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Initializes the controller and refreshes the user list. This method is called automatically when the associated view is loaded.

    • addUser

      public void addUser(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws IOException
      Adds a new user based on the input from the 'Enteruser' TextField. It also checks for the validity of the username and uniqueness before adding.
      Parameters:
      e - The action event triggering this method.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • showAlert

      private void showAlert(String title, String content)
      Displays an alert dialog with a specified title and content.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the alert dialog.
      content - The content text to be displayed inside the alert.

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws IOException
      Deletes a user from the list based on the selection in the 'UserList' ListView.
      Parameters:
      e - The action event triggering this method.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • refresh

      public void refresh()
      Refreshes the ListView 'UserList' with the current list of users. It updates the observableArrayList with the latest usernames.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the controller class. This method is automatically called after the FXML fields have been injected.

    • logOut

      public void logOut(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws IOException
      Handles the logout operation for the admin user.
      Parameters:
      e - The action event triggering this method.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
